function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Prevalence of symptoms of anxiety, depression, and trauma related to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerability of certain groups to mental health disturbances during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on unreliable or overwhelming information sources for pandemic-related information dissemination.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Prevalence of psychological problems and associated factors during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Studies related to the pandemic may have limitations due to the sars-cov-2 outbreak, impacting the randomization of the sample.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Online surveys as the main method of information collection may trigger biases in participant selection, such as oversampling of certain demographics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of specific populations in review studies may lead to the oversight of key findings related to vulnerable and underrepresented communities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of clear and direct information policies on pandemic management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low quality and veracity of internet information","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to specific recommendations and official sources on the internet and media","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing fake news, conspiracy theories, and magic cures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excessive access to information leading to an ’infodemic’","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Factors associated with mental health disturbances , gender, age, income, social networks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Young people between 18 and 30 are the most psychologically affected by the pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Loss of income during the covid-19 crisis is associated with poor mental ptsd","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low-income level contributing to worse mental health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Marital status
